intro: Isolepis exserens, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a perennial grass-like plant native to wetlands and marshy areas in the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and other similar plants. The plant typically grows in dense clusters, with slender, cylindrical stems that are often reddish in color. Its flowering spikes are small and inconspicuous, with tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Isolepis exserens plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
